meanings.definition: Cease work or movement in order to relax or recover strength.
meanings.sent1: After a long day of playing outside, the children needed to rest.
meanings.sent2: I will rest on the couch for a while before starting dinner.
meanings.sent3: The tired puppy decided to rest under the shady tree.
meanings.sent4: Her mind could finally rest after finishing the challenging puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The old man's weary legs begged for a moment to rest.

meanings.definition: Remain or be left in a specified condition.
meanings.sent1: The decision will rest with the board of directors.
meanings.sent2: The responsibility to organize the event will rest on Sarah's shoulders.
meanings.sent3: The fate of the treasure hunt will rest on the final clue.
meanings.sent4: The success of the project will ultimately rest on teamwork.
meanings.sent5: The future of the company will rest on the CEO's strategic plan.

meanings.definition: Support or be supported so as to allow free movement.
meanings.sent1: The swing set is designed to rest on sturdy metal poles.
meanings.sent2: The bridge's weight will rest on the strong foundation pillars.
meanings.sent3: The heavy chandelier will rest securely on the ceiling hooks.
meanings.sent4: The responsibility to hold up the banner will rest on the wooden pole.
meanings.sent5: The fragile vase will rest safely on the cushioned shelf.
